string.value: EasyBCD Community Edition is freely licensed for non-commercial use. If you are using this software in a commercial environment, please click 'Cancel' below to purchase a commercial license. Otherwise, click 'OK' to continue.

The current file is in use and cannot be opened by EasyBCD. If you're trying to (re)select the system store, press No below and then use the "Load System Store" option from the File menu.
Would you like to select a different store for use in EasyBCD?
Network paths are not supported for this feature. Please enter a different path and try again.
Invalid file or path name detected. Please enter a valid path to continue.
Update check failed. Error establishing network connection.
A new version of EasyBCD has been found. Would you like to go to the EasyBCD download page now to upgrade to the latest version?
You have the latest version of EasyBCD.
EasyBCD requires administrator privileges to run correctly, and cannot continue.
Please log on or run as an Administrator in order to continue.

In order for EasyBCD to boot into MS-DOS 6.x or Windows 3.x, IO.SYS and MSDOS.SYS must be at the start of the active partition.
For more information on how this is accomplished, press 'Yes' to open the EasyBCD documentation page for DOS-based entries. If you'd rather not view the documentation right now, press 'No' instead.
{0} added to the boot menu successfully!
The image path must not contain any spaces. Please correct this and try again.

EasyBCD lets you create extra entries to boot into the same OS, but with different options. By creating a new entry and giving it one of the Safe Mode flags, you can use it to quickly debug your system.
Normal: Disables all recovery options, letting you boot into your OS normally.
Basic VGA: Loads the basic display drivers, resetting the screen resolution.
Safe Mode w/ Networking: Boot into safe mode with access to the internet and local network.
Safe Mode: Boot into safe mode with no network access. Useful if the network drivers have been corrupted.
Active Directory Repair: Boots Windows Server 2008 into Active Directory repair mode.
Physical address extension determines how Windows will map extra memory beyond the 4 GiB memory marker.
Default: Lets Windows determine how memory will be mapped.
Force Disable: Disables the mapping of extra memory.
DEP/NoExecute is a hardware-layer malicious script detection system introduced in Windows XP SP2 that can help protect your system from attack, but it is known cause some compatibility problems.
OptOut: Windows and applications are DEP-protected.
AlwaysOn: DEP is forced for all applications.
AlwaysOff: DEP is disabled for Windows and all applications.

The boot partition must be a primary partition.
Please either select a different drive or convert the selected partition to primary first, then try again.
EasyBCD cannot make unmounted drives bootable. Please assign a letter to the selected drive, restart EasyBCD, and try again.

EasyBCD has successfully converted the selected disk into a bootable drive. In order to configure the boot menu entries on the selected partition, you must use 'File | Select BCD Store' and choose the \\boot\\BCD file on the partition you just prepped.
Would you like to automatically load the newly-created BCD store in EasyBCD now?
Unable to obtain access to the BCD. Please check and make sure that the BCD store on the selected device is not currently in use.
This is an advanced option that should only be use if you're absolutely sure you wish to uninstall the Windows Vista/7 Bootloader!
This feature will only boot into Windows XP if the proper boot files are already in place!
Are you sure you wish to continue?

The BCD has been successfully reset. All entries have been erased!
Important: You must add at least one entry or else your PC will not boot!

EasyBCD will re-configure your system to boot from the partition you select below. This process will set up a BCD store on the selected disk, copy the current BCD entries over, and make the selected partition both active & bootable.

An attempt was made to change the boot partition to a logical drive, which is not allowed. The boot partition must be a primary partition.
Please either select a different drive or convert the selected partition to primary first, then try again.

EasyBCD has successfully made drive {0} the new boot partition, and has loaded the new BCD store for modification, should you wish to make any further changes. If this partition is on your first boot disk, you don't need to take any further action. If it's not, you should now turn off your PC and change the boot drive from the BIOS for the changes to take effect.
This option is only available on Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Windows 8.
Fatal error: Unable to restore selected store.
Are you sure you want to delete this entry?
With this feature, EasyBCD will load and use an external BCD database of your choice. Changes will be made to this BCD store and will not affect your default system configuration.
You either don't have permission to write to the selected file, the file is set to read-only, or is stored on a read-only medium.
If you choose to proceed, changes made to this BCD store will not be saved. Press 'Yes' to continue and load this BCD store in read-only mode or 'No' to continue using the previous BCD store.
No BCD store loaded. EasyBCD running in limited mode.
Are you sure you want to restart your computer?

Boot.ini is located on the hidden boot partition and cannot be loaded for user editing by EasyBCD.
Please either assign a drive letter to the hidden boot partition or use the Windows XP dual-boot auto-configuration feature instead.

EasyBCD could not detect an existing boot.ini file on the boot partition {0}.
Please add a new Windows XP or Windows 2000 entry to use the boot.ini auto-configuration feature instead.
Displays information regarding your current hardware and software configuration. Useful for pinning down hardware failures and for quickly getting a dump of the current system setup.
Quick access to a command-line shell with full administrative privileges. Use it for carrying out system functions or quick access to bcdedit and bootsect.exe.
Opens the System Restore panel, use it to quickly revert/fix any changes that leave your PC in trouble.
Download a copy of the Windows Vista and Windows 7 system restore CDs to keep at hand in case disaster strikes. You can use EasyBCD to boot into these recovery discs from a USB.
Launch the Control Panel, and use it to do whatever you like.
NeoSmart Technologies' helper app for EasyBCD. iReboot sits in your taskbar (taking up only 400KB of memory!) and lets you choose which operating system to reboot into quickly and easily.

EasyBCD has detected that there are no entries currently installed. If you exit EasyBCD and restart your computer, it will not boot.
Are you sure you want to exit before adding a new entry?
EasyBCD failed to save the current backup path as the default backup directory. The option has been disabled.
EasyBCD supports loading ISO images in two different modes. Please note that not all ISOs will function correctly; usually Linux setup ISOs will not work.
Run from Disk: Loads quicker at boot, but runs slower. Also requires pre-processing by EasyBCD during creation.
Load from Memory: Runs faster, but takes time to load upon selection during boot. May fail for larger discs or older PCs.

The selected file is stored on a different device than the boot files. If you intend on using this entry to boot on a different PC than one you are currently using, you should copy this file to the external drive then try again.
Would you like to continue anyway?
No BCD registry loaded - running in reduced-functionality mode!
BCD reset successfully. Please reconfigure now!
Cached BCD data has been successfully refreshed

A new version of EasyBCD has been found. Would you like EasyBCD to automatically update to the latest version?
Press 'Yes' to automatically download and upgrade, 'No' to see the list of changes and upgrade manually, or 'Cancel' to cancel.
